message.content:
Sure, I can help you create a healthy meal plan that meets your dietary restrictions. Here's an example of a healthy meal plan for today:

1. Whole30 Grilled Chicken with Roasted Vegetables
   - Ingrédients: 4 boneless chicken breasts, 2 small zucchini, 1 medium yellow onion, 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt and pepper to taste
   - Instructions: Preheat grill to medium heat. Season chicken with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and any desired hot sauce. Pat chicken dry. Place chicken on the grill and let cook until an internal temperature of 165°F is reached on all sides. Remove chicken from the grill and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
   - Nutrition Information (per serving): Calories: 300, Total Fat: 20g, Saturated Fat: 12g, Cholesterol: 0mg, Sodium: 830mg, Total Carbohydrates: 72g, Dietary Fiber: 4g, Sugars: 15g, Protein: 25g

2. Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables and Feta Cheesecake
   - Ingrédients: (1) 16 ounce can sweetened condensed milk, 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1 small red onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt and pepper to taste, 1 pound granny smith apples, peeled and sliced into bite-sized pieces, 1 small zucchini, sliced into bite-size pieces, 1 medium yellow onion, sliced into bite-size pieces, 1/4 cup almonds, chopped
   - Instructions: For the Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables and Feta Cheesecake: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook quinoa according to package directions, and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the roasted vegetables, onions, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix well until combined with the vegetables and other ingredients. Add chopped almonds or pistachios for an extra crunchy layer of flavor.

For the Whole30 Grilled Chicken with Roasted Vegetables: Cook chicken breasts according to package directions on the grill. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the roasted vegetables by melting in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sliced zucchini, red onion, and parsley; cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Remove vegetables from skillet and set aside.

Once the chicken is done cooking on the grill, remove the chicken breasts and let rest for 10 minutes before serving. To make the Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables and Feta Cheesecake: Preheat oven to 375°F. Combine the sweetened condensed milk, chopped fresh mint, chopped fresh parsley, small red onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt and pepper to taste, feta cheese, and sliced apples into bite-sized pieces. Mix well until combined with the vegetables and other ingredients. Place mixture in a large bowl, top with feta cheese, and drizzle with melted chocolate if desired.

Enjoy your healthy meal plan!
